info.question: The IAM dashboard gives you a sign in link in the form of a url with ______ as the first part of the url
You can customize your sign in link to replace the customer # part of the url with a more readable name
You use ______ to assign permissions to sets of users
You can activate ______ on your user's accounts for further security
IAM dashboard gives you a checklist telling you to
answers: Activate MFA on your root account
correctAnswer: Activate MFA on your root account

info.question: With MFA you can use either a ______ or a ______
an example of a virtual MFA device is
answers: a QR Reader on your iPhone

info.question: Two types of access for users are
With IAM, programatic access
answers: enables an access key ID and a secret access key for AWS API, CLI, SDK, and other development tools
enables a password that allows users to sign-in to the AWS console
enables an MFA key for AWS API, CLI, SDK, and other development tools
enables a link that allows users to sign-in to the AWS console
correctAnswer: enables an access key ID and a secret access key for AWS API, CLI, SDK, and other development tools

info.question: With IAM, AWS Management Console access
answers: enables an access key ID and a secret access key for AWS API, CLI, SDK, and other development tools
enables a password that allows users to sign-in to the AWS console
enables an MFA key for AWS API, CLI, SDK, and other development tools
enables a link that allows users to sign-in to the AWS console
correctAnswer: enables a password that allows users to sign-in to the AWS console

info.question: What are the three ways to add permissions to a user
answers: Add the user to a group with the permissions you want
Attach a permissions template to the user
correctAnswer: Add the user to a group with the permissions you want

info.question: These are examples of secure ways of granting permissions through IAM roles to entities that you trust
answers: Application code running on an EC2 instance that needs to perform actions on AWS resources
An AWS service that needs to act on resources in your account to provide its features
Users from a corporate directory who use identity federation with SAML
Users from a corporate directory who use a proprietary database to hold user ids and passwords
correctAnswer: Application code running on an EC2 instance that needs to perform actions on AWS resources
An AWS service that needs to act on resources in your account to provide its features
Users from a corporate directory who use identity federation with SAML

info.question: IAM roles issue keys that are valid for ______, making them a more secure way to grant access
IAM is
answers: configurable to specific regions or sets of regions

info.question: The root account is the account created
answers: when you first setup your AWS account
when you specifically create a root user
when you convert an existing user to the root user
when delete all other users in the account
correctAnswer: when you first setup your AWS account

info.question: The root account has ______ by default
answers: admin access to specific resources you define

info.question: The root account id is
answers: the email account you used when you first setup your AWS account
the user id you used when you first setup your AWS account
the account number of the account
the name of the holder of the email account you used when you first setup your AWS account
correctAnswer: the email account you used when you first setup your AWS account

info.question: New users have ______ when they are first created
New users are assigned ______ and ______ when first created
